content: #221 the common cap designed by kate salomon vermont hospitality extends to having extra layers available for winter visitors we designed this hat with ribbing that will stretch comfortably to fit heads 19 24 in circumference wear it slouched as a cuffed watch cap or somewhere in between add a fun pop of color or stripes to personalize each hat and use up leftover skeins knit one for every member of your family and a few extras just in case sizes s m l finished circumference 16 un-stretched depth 9½ 10½ 11 gauge 18 stitches / 23 row over 4 in stockinette materials yarn 1 1 2 skeins weekend wool or mountain mohair needles us 5 / 3 75mm 16 inch circular needle us 7 / 4 5mm 16 inch circular needles and dpns notions stitch markers 6 total glossary pm = place marker rs = right side ws = wrong side k2tog = knit 2 sts together k f/b = knit into the front and back of the next stitch increasing one stitch instructions all sizes using larger needle cast on 88 stitches and join to work in the round place marker to indicate beginning of round and switch to smaller needles k2 p2* repeat to end of round work in 2/2 rib for 2½ 3½ 3½ switch to larger needles and k1 k f/b knit to three stitches before end of row k f/b k2 90 stitches work in stockinette until hat measures 6 8 8½ from cast on decrease rounds row 1 - knit 13 k2tog pm* repeat to end of round row 2 13 - knit to 2 stitches before marker k2tog sm* repeat to end of round row 14 k2tog* repeat to end of row 6 stitches remaining cut yarn and weave in ends finishing weave ends in on wrong side your garment will be softer and more beautiful after a gentle washing by hand in warm water and a mild soap ordetergent then roll in a towel to remove excess moisture or spin dry in a washing machine for 10 seconds only lay flat to dry in a well-ventilated area block if necessary green mountain spinnery po box 568 putney vermont 05346-0568 phone 802 387 4528 fax 802 387 4841 email spinnery@ spinnery com ©copyright green mountain spinnery increase 2016
